intro: Lobelia odontoptera, commonly known as the toothed lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many other lobelias and bellflowers. Lobelia odontoptera is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
